channel.title: PI need help
channel.description:
hello guys.
I'm a new coder and i only know the basic things like changhing items in shop movings npcs etc adding items.
but now i got 2 problems that i can't fix by myself.
1. in the duel arena interface i want to change Fun weapons to Whip/dds only. (on the interface self ingame i already did it that you can only use whip and dds)
2. how can i let people take items out of shop for free just like a bank.
you can add me on skype: Ragepattient
or write here how i need to fix it and i will try it
thanks already

item.title: PI need help
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

I made some changes to your code. I commented everything I edited. I personally couldn’t test it. So it may or may not work.
Your server was adding the items 1 at a time, in a loop. Buying 50k items would take AGES with that… So I removed the loop and made it add all items at once. However I didn’t make any real modifications to checking if you have enough slots for the item(s) you’re buying. You may want to fix it.

[code=java] public boolean buyItem(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) {
if (c.myShopId == 14) {
skillBuy(itemID);
return false;
} else if (c.myShopId == 15) {
buyVoid(itemID);
return false;
}

	if (!shopSellsItem(itemID))
		return false;
	
	if (amount > 0) {
		if (amount > Server.shopHandler.ShopItemsN[c.myShopId][fromSlot]) {
			amount = Server.shopHandler.ShopItemsN[c.myShopId][fromSlot];
		}
		// Renamed some variables.
		int totalPrice = 0;// TotPrice2
		int coinSlot = 0;// Slot
		int tokkulSlot = 0;// Slot1
		int pkPointSlot = 0;// Slot2
		
		if (c.myShopId >= 17 && c.myShopId <= 18 || c.myShopId == 29) {
			handleOtherShop(itemID);
			return false;
		}
		// for (int i = amount; i > 0; i--) {// Removed this for loop. Don't need this whatsoever.
			totalPrice = (int) Math.floor(getItemShopValue(itemID, 0,
					fromSlot)) * amount;// Added multiplying the price vs amount of items being bought.
			coinSlot = c.getItems().getItemSlot(995);
			tokkulSlot = c.getItems().getItemSlot(6529);
			/*
			 * if (Slot == -1 && c.myShopId != 101 && c.myShopId != 102 &&
			 * c.myShopId != 103 && c.myShopId != 104) {
			 * c.sendMessage("You don't have enough coins."); break; }
			 */
			// Removed the above, as I said before...
			if (tokkulSlot == -1 && c.myShopId == 100 || c.myShopId == 101
					|| c.myShopId == 102) {
				c.sendMessage("You don't have enough tokkul.");
				return false;
			}
			if (totalPrice <= 1) {
				totalPrice = (int) Math.floor(getItemShopValue(itemID, 0,
						fromSlot)) * amount;
				totalPrice *= 1.66;
			}
			
			if (c.getItems().freeSlots() < 1) {// Note: You're going to want to add Noted item support, and better handling of checking free slots.
				c.sendMessage("You don't have enough space in your inventory.");
				return false;
			}
			
			if (c.myShopId != 100 && c.myShopId != 101 && c.myShopId != 102
					&& c.myShopId != 103) {// Changed or ( || ) to and ( && ). Wrong operator can cause issues later...
					c.getItems().addItem(itemID, amount);// Changed to add all the items, not one at a time.
					Server.shopHandler.ShopItemsN[c.myShopId][fromSlot] -= amount;// Removing Item.
					Server.shopHandler.ShopItemsDelay[c.myShopId][fromSlot] = 0;// Resetting Item delay.
					if ((fromSlot + 1) > Server.shopHandler.ShopItemsStandard[c.myShopId]) {
						Server.shopHandler.ShopItems[c.myShopId][fromSlot] = 0;
					}
			} else if (c.myShopId == 101 || c.myShopId == 102 || c.myShopId == 103) {
				if (c.playerItemsN[tokkulSlot] >= totalPrice) {
						c.getItems().deleteItem(6529,
								c.getItems().getItemSlot(6529), totalPrice);
						c.getItems().addItem(itemID, amount);
						Server.shopHandler.ShopItemsN[c.myShopId][fromSlot] -= amount;
						Server.shopHandler.ShopItemsDelay[c.myShopId][fromSlot] = 0;
						if ((fromSlot + 1) > Server.shopHandler.ShopItemsStandard[c.myShopId]) {
							Server.shopHandler.ShopItems[c.myShopId][fromSlot] = 0;
						}
				} else {
					c.sendMessage("You don't have enough tokkul.");
					return false;
				}
			}
		//}
		c.getItems().resetItems(3823);
		resetShop(c.myShopId);
		updatePlayerShop();
		return true;
	}
	return false;
}[/code]

Read full topic

                                                    c.getItems().addItem(itemID, 1);// Adding the item to inventory.

hmm okay. so i thought about it and i took ur hint.

is it this?

if(c.myShopId != 100 || c.myShopId != 101 || c.myShopId != 102 || c.myShopId != 103) { if (c.playerItemsN[Slot] >= TotPrice2) {// Checking if coins are greater than or equal to TotPrice2 if (c.getItems().freeSlots() > 0) {// Making sure they have at least 1 slot. c.getItems().deleteItem(0, c.getItems().getItemSlot(0), TotPrice2); // Changed 995 to 0 c.getItems().addItem(itemID, 1);// Adding the item to inventory. Server.shopHandler.ShopItemsN[c.myShopId][fromSlot] -= 1;// Removing item from shop. Server.shopHandler.ShopItemsDelay[c.myShopId][fromSlot] = 0;// Resetting Item delay. if ((fromSlot + 1) > Server.shopHandler.ShopItemsStandard[c.myShopId]) { Server.shopHandler.ShopItems[c.myShopId][fromSlot] = 0; } } else { c.sendMessage("You don't have enough space in your inventory."); break; } } else { c.sendMessage("You don't have enough coins."); break; } }

item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“runeball, post:11, topic:546792”]so is it

if(c.myShopId != 100 || c.myShopId != 101 || c.myShopId != 102 || c.myShopId != 103) { if (c.playerItemsN[Slot] >= TotPrice0) {// Checking if coins are greater than or equal to TotPrice0 if (c.getItems().freeSlots() > 0) {// Making sure they have at least 1 slot. c.getItems().deleteItem(995, c.getItems().getItemSlot(995), TotPrice2); // Deleting the coins from inventory. c.getItems().addItem(itemID, 1);// Adding the item to inventory. Server.shopHandler.ShopItemsN[c.myShopId][fromSlot] -= 1;// Removing item from shop. Server.shopHandler.ShopItemsDelay[c.myShopId][fromSlot] = 0;// Resetting Item delay. if ((fromSlot + 1) > Server.shopHandler.ShopItemsStandard[c.myShopId]) { Server.shopHandler.ShopItems[c.myShopId][fromSlot] = 0; } } else { c.sendMessage("You don't have enough space in your inventory."); break; } } else { c.sendMessage("You don't have enough coins."); break; } }

i changed

to

No that would throw an error.

The variable is declared as TotPrice2. TotPrice0 would be another variable entirely, and if you didn’t declare it, it would throw an error saying the symbol cannot be found.
You’re really close though…
Hint: Why check to see if they have coins, if the items are free?

item.title: PI need help
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“runeball, post:9, topic:546792”]thank you i got the duel interface fixed ;D really thank you i searched like 2 days for this’’

how do i make items free in shop now?

like i got item 4151 in shop and it cost 0 GP but you need 1 gp to take it.

but instead of that i want that you just can take it without needing money with you.[/quote]
Look into the buyItem method (it returns a boolean, but that’s not relevant atm).
As far as I know,
int TotPrice2 = 0;
Is going to be the value of your item.

In this block of code is your issue. I commented it a bit, so you hopefully see the issue.

if(c.myShopId != 100 || c.myShopId != 101 || c.myShopId != 102 || c.myShopId != 103) { if (c.playerItemsN[Slot] >= TotPrice2) {// Checking if coins are greater than or equal to TotPrice2 if (c.getItems().freeSlots() > 0) {// Making sure they have at least 1 slot. c.getItems().deleteItem(995, c.getItems().getItemSlot(995), TotPrice2); // Deleting the coins from inventory. c.getItems().addItem(itemID, 1);// Adding the item to inventory. Server.shopHandler.ShopItemsN[c.myShopId][fromSlot] -= 1;// Removing item from shop. Server.shopHandler.ShopItemsDelay[c.myShopId][fromSlot] = 0;// Resetting Item delay. if ((fromSlot + 1) > Server.shopHandler.ShopItemsStandard[c.myShopId]) { Server.shopHandler.ShopItems[c.myShopId][fromSlot] = 0; } } else { c.sendMessage("You don't have enough space in your inventory."); break; } } else { c.sendMessage("You don't have enough coins."); break; } }

item.title: PI need help
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

When you say “where can I find the sendframe thing?” I don’t exactly know what you mean.
Are you asking where you can find that one specific method? Because it will be located in PlayerAssistant.java (unless someone has modified your code, and moved it from there).

OR are you asking where you would use it? Because that’s a lot different and that also varies.

Most people have a method in PlayerAssistant, called “loginText” or “welcomeText” or something similar.
In Client.java (Remember, server sided) you’ll have a method called “initialize”. Find it.
Within that method, you’ll have a lot of code, and somewhere you’ll see the method I told you above ^^ is called.
That means it is sent whenever the player logs in.
If you don’t have a method like that, or you can’t seem to find it, we can always make it:

Here’s the method you’ll want to make (or similar…)

public void sendLoginFrames() {
     c.getPA().sendFrame126("Your text", THE_ID_HERE);
}

Note: Replace the words “your text” with the text you want, and “THE_ID_HERE” with an integer (number, aka 669)

Now call that method ^ in initialize of Client.java
You’ll call it like so:

c.getPA().sendLoginFrames();

After compiling, when you login, the frames will be sent. So check the duel interface after all this.

Read full topic

item.title: PI need help
item.dc:creator: @runeball runeball
item.description:
@runeball wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:6, topic:546792”][quote author=Damoiscool link=topic=665688.msg4450170#msg4450170 date=1410829306]
For both of those things, I’ll need to see your RSInterface.java (Client Sided) and ShopAssistant.java (Server Sided) You can either use http://pastebin.com/ or use code tags

i.e. select all the code and click the # above
[/quote]
The duel interface isn’t hardcoded, so you don’t really need RSInterface for that.

OP: Below is a list of frames, along with their parent ID’s. The parent ID is 6575, which should be your dueling interface.

6671 Dueling with: 6575 6677 Opponents Stake: 6575 6678 Your Stake: 6575 6680 Accept 6575 6682 Decline 6575 6684 Neither player is allowed to forfeit the duel. 6575 13796 Close Window 6575 6696 No Forfeit 6575 6697 No Magic 6575 6698 No Ranged 6575 6699 No Melee 6575 6701 No Drinks 6575 6702 No Food 6575 6703 No Prayer 6575 6704 No Movement 6575 6731 Obstacles 6575 669 Fun Weapons 6575 7817 No Sp. Atk 6575 8260 Neither player is allowed to forfeit the duel. 6575 8262 Players stand next to each other and aren't allowed to move. 6575 8264 Neither player is allowed to use weapons. 6575 8266 Neither player is allowed to use armour. 6575 8268 Neither player is allowed to wear jewelry. 6575 8270 Neither player is allowed to use ranged attacks. 6575 8272 Neither player is allowed to use melee attacks. 6575 8274 Neither player is allowed to use magic attacks. 6575 8276 Neither player will be allowed to use special attacks. 6575 8278 Both players will use a 'fun weapon', such as: flowers or rubber chicken. 6575 8280 Neither player will be allowed to use drinks. 6575 8282 Neither player will be allowed to use food. 6575 8284 Neither player will be allowed to use prayer. 6575 8286 The duel will be in an arena with obstacles. 6575 13837 Neither player will be allowed to wear items on their head. 6575 13839 Neither player will be allowed to wear items on their back. 6575 13841 Neither player will be allowed to wear items around their neck. 6575 13843 Neither player will be allowed to use 2-handed items or items in their right hand. 6575 13845 Neither player will be allowed to wear items on their torso. 6575 13847 Neither player will be allowed to use 2-handed items or items in their left hand. 6575 13849 Neither player will be allowed to wear items on their legs. 6575 13851 Neither player will be allowed to wear items on their hands. 6575 13853 Neither player will be allowed to wear items on their feet. 6575 13855 Neither player will be allowed to wear items on their fingers. 6575 13857 Neither player will be allowed to have items in their quiver. 6575
669 Fun Weapons 6575
So you’ll want to replace the text on frame 669.

Example:
c.getPA().sendFrame126(“Your text”, 669);

(I would send that on login, as you won’t be changing the text any other time)

As for the shop issue:

It may or may not be related to:

if(TotPrice2 <= 1) { TotPrice2 = (int)Math.floor(getItemShopValue(itemID, 0, fromSlot)); TotPrice2 *= 1.66; }
Or similar.
(that was found in your code, btw)[/quote]

i feel so dumb… where can i find the sendframe thing?

can somebody teach me how to do this from the beginning what i need to open and what i need to search etc and change.

if you want please add me on skype: Ragepattient

i don’t want people to do it for me because i want to do it by myself so nobody needs to spoonfeed me when i need to do it again

Read full topic

Atk 6575 8260 Neither player is allowed to forfeit the duel. 6575 8262 Players stand next to each other and aren't allowed to move. 6575 8264 Neither player is allowed to use weapons. 6575 8266 Neither player is allowed to use armour. 6575 8268 Neither player is allowed to wear jewelry. 6575 8270 Neither player is allowed to use ranged attacks. 6575 8272 Neither player is allowed to use melee attacks. 6575 8274 Neither player is allowed to use magic attacks. 6575 8276 Neither player will be allowed to use special attacks. 6575 8278 Both players will use a 'fun weapon', such as: flowers or rubber chicken. 6575 8280 Neither player will be allowed to use drinks. 6575 8282 Neither player will be allowed to use food. 6575 8284 Neither player will be allowed to use prayer. 6575 8286 The duel will be in an arena with obstacles. 6575 13837 Neither player will be allowed to wear items on their head. 6575 13839 Neither player will be allowed to wear items on their back. 6575 13841 Neither player will be allowed to wear items around their neck. 6575 13843 Neither player will be allowed to use 2-handed items or items in their right hand. 6575 13845 Neither player will be allowed to wear items on their torso. 6575 13847 Neither player will be allowed to use 2-handed items or items in their left hand. 6575 13849 Neither player will be allowed to wear items on their legs. 6575 13851 Neither player will be allowed to wear items on their hands. 6575 13853 Neither player will be allowed to wear items on their feet. 6575 13855 Neither player will be allowed to wear items on their fingers. 6575 13857 Neither player will be allowed to have items in their quiver. 6575

As for the shop issue:
